edu.rice.comp440.rovers.model.rovers

Class AbstractRover<PerceptsType extends IPercepts>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rice.comp440.rovers.model.rovers.AbstractRover<PerceptsType>
  • Type Parameters:
    PerceptsType - The type of percepts this rover will receive.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAntRover, AbstractSmartRover

    public abstract class AbstractRover<PerceptsType extends IPercepts>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class from which all rovers will descend.

    • Field Detail

      • bumpDispatcher

        public edu.rice.comp440.rovers.control.Dispatcher<Position> bumpDispatcher
        When this rover bumps something, whatever it bumps should use this dispatcher to notify any interested parties that a bump occurred. The bumper should dispatch its own position. That is, if a tile refuses to allow a rover to move into it, it should dispatch its own position through the bump dispatcher, to allow others to be aware that the rover "discovered" that obstacle. If the bumper doesn't have a position (it's beyond the map) it can dispatch null.

      • changePositionDispatcher

        public edu.rice.comp440.rovers.control.Dispatcher<Position> changePositionDispatcher
        This dispatcher will be used to signal to any interested parties that this rover's position has changed.

      • newPositionDispatcher

        public edu.rice.comp440.rovers.control.Dispatcher<Position> newPositionDispatcher
        This dispatcher will signal that this rover has just moved to a previously unexplored position.

    • Method Detail

      • setModel

        public void setModel(edu.rice.comp440.rovers.model.Model model)
        Extending classes should take this method as an opportunity to reach into the model's percept factories and retrieve an instance of their chosen percepts. It might seem logical to task the Model with "giving" a Percept to a Rover instance, and not the other way around like here, but we run into a problem: Rovers are parameterized by the specific Percept type that they accept (in order to have absolute type safety when calling nextAction(...)), which means that we would force Model to become aware of the specific parameterized type of the Rovers it is holding. That would be a nightmare. Instead, we task the varying Rovers themselves with awareness of the Percept they desire.
        Parameters:
        model - The model

      • step

        public abstract Action step()
        This is the method that will be called by Model when it wants to step the simulation forward. Extending classes should then take their chosen Percept and use it to call nextAction(...). The action returned by nextAction(...) will be returned here to the model.
        Returns:
        The action this rover wants to take.

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Get the rover's current position.
        Returns:
        The rover's current position.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Position newPosition)
        Set the rover's position. the rover will notify any interested parties of this move, and whether or not it's into newly discovered territory.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - The new position of the rover.

      • debugDraw

        public abstract void debugDraw(edu.rice.comp440.rovers.view.DebugDrawer.DebugAssistant debugAssistant)
        This method is to be implemented by the user, and permits them to draw some debug information onto a GUI gameboard to diagnose the behavior of their rovers.
        Parameters:
        debugAssistant - A class to assist in drawing the information.
